children.name: to finish doing st or making st
finish
children.definition: /ˈfɪnɪʃ/  to finish doing or making something: hoàn thành
examples: ▪ have you finished your homework yet?
▪ he was in london at the time, finishing a degree in economics.
▪ the builders say they should have finished by friday.
▪ ‘to think you might have been ...’ carlos didn’t finish his sentence.
finish doing something hoàn thành việc gì
▪ give me a call when you’ve finished unpacking.
▪ let me finish washing the dishes, then i can help you.

children.name: have done st
children.definition: have done something/həv ˈdʌn something/  if you have done a piece of work, you have finished doing it: đã xong với việc gì
examples: ▪ ask jane if she’s done that essay yet.
▪ i’ve done all the painting. now all that’s left is to put the pictures back up.

children.name: complete
children.definition: /kəmˈpliːt/  to finish making something, writing something, or doing something that takes alongtime to finish: hoàn tất
examples: ▪ the building is likely to be completed in two years’ time.
▪ the novel wasn’t published until 40 years after it was completed.
completion[uncountable noun] sự hoàn chỉnh
▪ on completion of the course you will be given a certificate of competence.

children.name: get st finished
children.definition: get something finished/ˌget something ˈfɪnɪʃt/  to make an effort to finish something before you do something else: làm xong cái gì
examples: ▪ i’d like to get all these letters finished so i can mail them on my way home.
▪ he doesn’t think he’s going to get the baby’s room finished before it’s born.

children.name: be through
children.definition: /biː ˈθruː/  informal to have finished doing something: xong việc
examples: ▪ we thought it would only take a few minutes to put up the tent but by the time we were through it was dark.
be through with xong việc
▪ the mechanic thought he’d be through with the car at about four.

children.name: conclude
children.definition: /kənˈkluːd/  formal to finish a piece of work or process etc properly and completely, especially so that you are ready to use the results of it: chấm dứt
examples: ▪ by july the research team had concluded the main part of its work.
▪ the police have now concluded their investigations.

children.name: finished
children.definition: /ˈfɪnɪʃt/  kết thúc
examples: ▪ all the packing was finished and we were ready to leave.
▪ a young couple moved into the house three weeks after it was finished.
▪ the finished book was more of a personal diary than an autobiography.
finished version/product/article etc phiên bản, sản phẩm, bài tin cuối cùng
▪ looking at the finished product, you wouldn’t know it was made from paper.

children.name: be complete
children.definition: /biː kəmˈpliːt/  if something that involves anumber of stagesis complete, it is finished: kết thúc
examples: ▪ you’ll be paid more when your training is complete.
▪ building work should be complete within 20 weeks.
▪ when the mixing process is complete, the mixture is ready to be heated.

children.name: be done
children.definition: /biː ˈdʌn/  to besuccessfullyfinished: hoàn thành
examples: ▪ mom won’t let me watch television till all my homework’s done.
▪ we’ll send you a bill when the repairs are done.

children.name: completed
children.definition: /kəmˈpliːtɪd, kəmˈpliːtəd/  finished, especially after alongperiod of time ora lotof work: hoàn tất
examples: ▪ we’ll only get paid if the job is satisfactorily completed.
▪ at last all the arrangements were completed and we waited impatiently for the big day to arrive.

children.name: to finish a performance, speech, meeting etc
finish/ end
children.definition: finish/end /ˈfɪnɪʃ, end/  kết thúc
examples: ▪ when sir george finished his speech there was a moment’s silence.
finish/end something by doing something kết thúc cái gì bằng cách làm cái gì
▪ the priest ended the service by saying a short prayer.
finish/end something with something kết thúc cái gì bằng cái gì
▪ she ended her recital with an old french song.

children.name: round off
children.definition: /ˌraʊnd ˈɒf/  to do something as a way of ending an event, performance etc in asuitableorsatisfactoryway:
examples: kết thúc
round off something kết thúc cái gì
▪ to round off national peace week, a concert was organized in the park.
round something off with something
kết thúc cái gì bằng cái gì
▪ she served us a splendid dinner, rounded off with a marvellous orange mousse.
▪ they rounded off the day with a barbecue at the beach.

children.name: wind up
children.definition: /ˌwaɪnd ˈʌp/  to gradually end an event or activity such as a meeting, making sure that it finishes at the right time: hoàn thành
examples: ▪ about 40 minutes after the interview starts, the interviewer will signal to you to start winding up.
wind up something hoàn thành cái gì
▪ he was fired and the board would give him no more time to wind up his affairs.
wind something up hoàn thành cái gì
▪ mark wanted to wind the meeting up quickly because he had a plane to catch.

children.name: bring st to an end
children.definition: bring something to an end/to a close/ˌbrɪŋ something tʊ ən ˈend, tʊ ə ˈkləʊz/  to formally finish a meeting, lesson, process etc: đi đến hồi kết
examples: ▪ the committee has brought to a close one of the longest-running senate investigations ever.
▪ efforts must continue to bring the conflict to an end.

children.name: conclude
children.definition: /kənˈkluːd/  to formally or officially end a meeting, public event, speech etc by doing one final thing: chấm dứt
examples: conclude something with something chấm dứt cái gì bằng cái gì
▪ this year, muslims will conclude ramadan with the usual festivities on april 15 or 16.
conclude with chấm dứt bằng
▪ he concluded with an appeal to everyone to support the campaign.
conclude by doing something chấm dứt bằng cách làm gì
▪ i’d like to conclude by thanking everyone who has worked so hard to make this conference possible.

children.name: round off
children.definition: /ˌraʊnd ˈɒf/  to do something as a way of ending an event, performance etc in a suitable or satisfactory way: kết thúc
examples: round off somethingkết thúc cái gì
▪ to round off national peace week, a concert was organized in the park.
round something off with something kết thúc cái gì bằng cái gì
▪ she served us a splendid dinner, rounded off with a marvellous orange mousse.
▪ they rounded off the day with a barbecue at the beach.

children.name: finish off/finish up
children.definition: /ˌfɪnɪʃ ˈɒf, ˌfɪnɪʃ ˈʌp/  to complete an event, performance, piece of work etc by doing one final thing that is necessary or suitable: kết thúc
examples: ▪ please finish off now. the test will end in three minutes.
▪ you can finish up the puzzle tomorrow morning. it’s time for bed now.
finish off/up something by doing something kết thúc cái gì bằng cách làm gì
▪ we finished off our vacation by spending two days in santa fe.
finish off/up something with something kết thúc cái gì bằng cái gì
▪ dan finished up his act with a joke about the vice-president.

children.name: finalize
children.definition: alsofinalisebritish /ˈfaɪnəl-aɪz/  to do thelastthingsthat are necessary in order tosettlean agreement, plan, or arrangement in a satisfactory way:
examples: hoàn thành
▪ mr samuels is flying to detroit to finalize the details and sign the contract.
▪ the meeting has been postponed until travel arrangements can be finalized.

children.name: be nearly finished
children.definition: /done/throughespecially british also be almost finished/done/through /biː ˌnɪəʳli ˈfɪnɪʃt, ˈdʌn, ˈθruː, biː ˌɔːlməʊst ˈfɪnɪʃt, ˈdʌn, ˈθruː/  gần xong
examples: ▪ i’m nearly finished -- i just want to put these files away.
▪ are you almost done in the shower?
▪ just give me a couple more minutes. i’m nearly through.

children.name: be on the last lap
children.definition: /in the home stretch/biː ɒn ðə ˌlɑːst ˈlæpǁ-ˌlæst-, ɪn ðə ˌhəʊm ˈstretʃ/  to have almost finished something, especially something that has taken a long time: còn vài bước cuối
examples: ▪ the election campaign is now on its last lap.
▪ the regular season is in the home stretch, and the playoffs will soon begin.

children.name: put the finishing touch
children.definition: /touches tobritish also put the finishing touch/touches on american /ˌpʊt ðə ˌfɪnɪʃɪŋ ˈtʌtʃ, ˈtʌtʃz tuː, ˌpʊt ðə ˌfɪnɪʃɪŋ ˈtʌtʃ, ˈtʌtʃz ɒn/  to finish something by adding the last details, especially in order to make it look nice: bước cuối cùng là
examples: ▪ sue’s just putting the finishing touches to her make-up.
▪ painters are putting the finishing touches on the baseboards and railings.
▪ the team are busy putting the finishing touches to the new design.
the finishing touch/touches[noun phrase] bước cuối cùng
▪ your patio is lovely. those tubs of flowers are the perfect finishing touch.

children.name: finish off
children.definition: /ˌfɪnɪʃ ˈɒf/  to finish something by adding the last parts or details: finish off something hoàn thành
examples: ▪ i came to work early this morning to finish off some urgent work for the boss.
finish something off hoàn thành việc gì
▪ i usually partially cook steaks in the microwave and then finish them off on the grill.

children.name: tie up the loose ends
children.definition: /ˌtaɪ ʌp ðə ˌluːs ˈendz/  to finish a meeting, an agreement etc by dealing with all the details that remain: chốt lại
examples: ▪ if we can tie up the loose ends in the next ten minutes, we’ll break for an early lunch.
▪ apart from a few loose ends that need to be tied up, everything has gone according to schedule.

children.name: be through/be done
children.definition: /biː ˈθruː, biː ˈdʌn/  to have finished using something: kết thúc
examples: ▪ i need to use the computer. can you let me know when you’re done?
be through/be done with kết thúc với
▪ aren’t you through with the phone yet?

children.name: finish with
children.definition: /ˈfɪnɪʃ wɪð/  especially british: đã xong với
examples: ▪ can you pass me the scissors when you’ve finished with them, please?
▪ ‘have you finished with the monopoly game?’ ‘yes.’ ‘well put it away then.’

children.name: to finish st that is difficult or unpleasant
get it over with
children.definition: /get it over and done with/ˌget ɪt ˈəʊvəʳ wɪð, ˌget ɪt ˌəʊvər ən ˈdʌn wɪð/  to do something now, without delaying any more, so that it is finished and you can stopworryingabout it:
examples: kết thúc
▪ i’m going to make an appointment at the dentist and get it over with before the holidays.
▪ let’s get the clean-up over and done with.

children.name: see through
children.definition: /ˌsiː ˈθruː/  đến cùng
examples: ▪ the course was hard, but i wanted to see it through.
▪ cassidy, aged 83, intends to see the project through to completion.

children.name: to the bitter end
children.definition: /tə ðə ˌbɪtər ˈend/  if you do something to the bitter end, you continue doing it in a determined way until it is finished, even though it is very unpleasant or difficult: kết thúc trong khổ cực
examples: ▪ campaigners vowed to carry on the struggle to the bitter end.
▪ despite his injury, johnson carried on playing on to the bitter end.

children.name: stick it out/stick with
children.definition: /ˌstɪk ɪt ˈaʊt, ˌstɪk ˈwɪð ɪt/  to finish doing something in spite of great difficulty or pain: thoát khỏi
examples: ▪ eleven girls joined the junior high football team, but only four stuck it out until the end of the season.
▪ it’s hard to stick with an exercise program you don’t enjoy.

children.name: have/be done with it
children.definition: /hæv, biː ˈdʌn wɪð ɪt/  especially british to do or finish something difficult or unpleasant now, so that you can stop thinking about it or worrying about it: kết thúc nó đi
examples: ▪ just go pay the fine and be done with it.
▪ if that’s what you want to do, for heaven’s sake do it and have done with it.
